# Define the base paths
base_input = "abfss://cyber-bullying@ayushdatalakestorage.dfs.core.windows.net/raw files/"
base_output = "abfss://cyber-bullying@ayushdatalakestorage.dfs.core.windows.net/processed/parquet/"

# List of folders from your image
folders = [
    "Aggressive_All", 
    "CB_Labels", 
    "Communication_Data_Among_Users", 
    "Non_Aggressive_All", 
    "peerness_values",
    "user_data"
]

for folder in folders:
    print(f"Processing: {folder}...")
    
    # Construct specific paths
    input_path = f"{base_input}{folder}/"
    output_path = f"{base_output}{folder}/"
    
    # Read the CSV files in the subfolder
    df = spark.read \
        .option("header", "true") \
        .option("inferSchema", "true") \
        .csv(input_path)
    
    # Write to Parquet
    df.write \
        .mode("overwrite") \
        .parquet(output_path)
    
    print(f"Successfully saved to: {output_path}")
    # Optional: Show a preview for each
    # df.show(2)

# Base path where your Parquet files are stored
base_parquet_path = "abfss://cyber-bullying@ayushdatalakestorage.dfs.core.windows.net/processed/parquet/"

# List of your datasets
folders = [
    "Aggressive_All", 
    "CB_Labels", 
    "Communication_Data_Among_Users", 
    "Non_Aggressive_All", 
    "peerness_values",
    "user_data"
]

# Database name (default is usually 'default')
db_name = "cyber_bullying_db"
spark.sql(f"CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS {db_name}")

for folder in folders:
    print(f"Creating table for: {folder}...")
    
    # Path to the specific parquet data
    parquet_path = f"{base_parquet_path}{folder}/"
    
    # Read the parquet file to get the schema
    df = spark.read.parquet(parquet_path)
    
    # Create or Replace the table
    # This creates an 'External' table pointing to your storage
    df.write.mode("overwrite").saveAsTable(f"{db_name}.{folder}")

print("\nAll tables created successfully!")
